items.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene to resign from Congress in January amid fallout with Trump
items.standfirst: Decision by Georgia Republican and leading Maga figure to give up House seat comes after dramatic break with Trump, lately over the Epstein files billReaction: Trump calls resignation ‘great news for the country’From staunch Trump ally to ‘traitor’: key takeaways of Marjorie Taylor Greene’s careerMarjorie Taylor Greene announced on Friday evening she will be resigning from office effective 5 January 2026, in the wake of souring relations with President Donald Trump, mostly recently over a vote to force the release of files related to the late Jeffrey Epstein.In a four-page statement, the Georgia congresswoman said the legislative branch had been “sidelined” and accused Republican leaders of refusing to advance conservative priorities such as border security or “America First” policies. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene says she's resigning from Congress
items.standfirst: Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia announced on X Friday​ she will resign from Congress early next year, after a weekslong falling-out with President Trump and much of her party.
items.content: Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia announced on X Friday​ she will resign from Congress early next year, after a weekslong falling-out with President Trump and much of her party.

items.title: Trump calls Marjorie Taylor Greene resignation ‘great news for the country’
items.standfirst: President says ‘I think she should be happy’ while Democratic colleague praises her for stance on Epstein filesFull report: Marjorie Taylor Greene to resign from Congress in JanuaryFrom staunch Trump ally to ‘traitor’: key takeaways of Marjorie Taylor Greene’s careerMarjorie Taylor Greene, the Republican Georgia congresswoman who had a dramatic blow-up with Donald Trump despite being his longtime ally, announced on Friday she would be resigning – which the president called “great news”.“Loyalty should be a two-way street,” Greene said in a lengthy resignation statement shared on social media, adding that it was “unfair and wrong” that Trump turned on her for disagreeing with him. Continue reading...
items.content: President says ‘I think she should be happy’ while Democratic colleague praises her for stance on Epstein filesFull report: Marjorie Taylor Greene to resign from Congress in JanuaryFrom staunch Trump ally to ‘traitor’: key takeaways of Marjorie Taylor Greene’s careerMarjorie Taylor Greene, the Republican Georgia congresswoman who had a dramatic blow-up with Donald Trump despite being his longtime ally, announced on Friday she would be resigning – which the president called “great news”.“Loyalty should be a two-way street,” Greene said in a lengthy resignation statement shared on social media, adding that it was “unfair and wrong” that Trump turned on her for disagreeing with him. Continue reading...

items.title: MAGA figure Marjorie Taylor Greene to quit US Congress after split with Trump
items.standfirst: Longtime Trump loyalist Marjorie Taylor Greene announced on Friday she was resigning from the House of Representatives in the wake of a dramatic falling out with the US president, who had labelled her a "traitor" and threatened to support a Republican challenger to unseat her in midterm elections.
items.content: Longtime Trump loyalist Marjorie Taylor Greene announced on Friday she was resigning from the House of Representatives in the wake of a dramatic falling out with the US president, who had labelled her a "traitor" and threatened to support a Republican challenger to unseat her in midterm elections.

items.title: After break with Trump, Marjorie Taylor Greene will resign
items.standfirst: Republican Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, an "America First" conservative who has clashed with President Trump and her party, said Friday she would resign from Congress Jan. 5, 2026.
items.content: Republican Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, an "America First" conservative who has clashed with President Trump and her party, said Friday she would resign from Congress Jan. 5, 2026.(Image credit: Daniel Heuer)

ai_summary: Georgia Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene will resign from Congress early next year, as announced on Friday.
The resignation follows a growing rift with former President Donald Trump over various issues.
Greene's departure is effective January 5, 2026, according to her statement.
Trump called the resignation "great news for the country" in response to the announcement.
The split between Greene and Trump has been public and acrimonious in recent weeks.

items.title: Ukraine’s allies to meet at G20 summit after Zelenskyy warns of ‘impossible choice’ over Trump plan to end war – live
items.standfirst: Trump has demanded Ukraine accepts a ‘peace plan’ that would force it to give up territory to Russia and make other painful concessionsWhat do we know about the reported US-Russian plan to end the Ukraine war? Well, full details are not yet clear but the 28-point deal is believed to include a proposal for Ukraine to hand territory to Russia, writes my colleague Jakub Krupa.Here are some more details:The price of peace cannot in any way be the achievement of strategic goals by the aggressor, and the aggressor was and remains the Russian Federation. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky has said his country faces a pivotal choice between standing up for its sovereign rights and preserving critical support from Washington as it faces intense pressure to agree to a US peace proposal that meets many of Russia's main war aims.
items.content: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky has said his country faces a pivotal choice between standing up for its sovereign rights and preserving critical support from Washington as it faces intense pressure to agree to a US peace proposal that meets many of Russia's main war aims.

items.title: Trump’s new Thanksgiving deadline for Ukraine peace plan
items.standfirst: President Trump said Ukraine had a Thursday deadline to give an answer on his new 28-point peace plan to end the war in Ukraine. NBC News’ Keir Simmons reports.
items.content: President Trump said Ukraine had a Thursday deadline to give an answer on his new 28-point peace plan to end the war in Ukraine. NBC News’ Keir Simmons reports.

items.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine has impossible choice as Trump pushes plan to end war
items.standfirst: US president demands that Kyiv accepts plan that would mean giving up territory to Russia Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said Ukraine faces one of the most difficult moments in its history, after Donald Trump demanded Kyiv accepts within days a US-backed “peace plan” that would force it to give up territory to Russia and make other painful concessions.Trump confirmed on Friday morning that next Thursday – Thanksgiving in the US – would be an “acceptable” deadline for Zelenskyy to sign the deal, which European and Ukrainian officials have said amounts to a “capitulation”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president demands that Kyiv accepts plan that would mean giving up territory to Russia Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said Ukraine faces one of the most difficult moments in its history, after Donald Trump demanded Kyiv accepts within days a US-backed “peace plan” that would force it to give up territory to Russia and make other painful concessions.Trump confirmed on Friday morning that next Thursday – Thanksgiving in the US – would be an “acceptable” deadline for Zelenskyy to sign the deal, which European and Ukrainian officials have said amounts to a “capitulation”. Continue reading...

items.title: How key players reacted to US plan to end war in Ukraine
items.standfirst: European leaders and UN officials voiced unease on Friday over a new US proposal to end the war in Ukraine, warning that Washington’s plan risked sidelining Kyiv and its allies. The 28-point plan calls for major concessions by Ukraine, including giving up a part of its eastern territory.
items.content: European leaders and UN officials voiced unease on Friday over a new US proposal to end the war in Ukraine, warning that Washington’s plan risked sidelining Kyiv and its allies. The 28-point plan calls for major concessions by Ukraine, including giving up a part of its eastern territory.

items.title: Volodymyr Zelensky faces an impossible dilemma for Ukraine
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is being pushed into a stark dilemma: accept the controversial US-backed peace plan — widely seen as overwhelmingly favourable to Russia — or risk being accused of rejecting peace and undermining Washington’s diplomatic efforts. President Donald Trump is now increasing pressure on Zelensky to endorse the proposal, leaving Kyiv with little room to manoeuvre, as FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg explains from Kyiv.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is being pushed into a stark dilemma: accept the controversial US-backed peace plan — widely seen as overwhelmingly favourable to Russia — or risk being accused of rejecting peace and undermining Washington’s diplomatic efforts. President Donald Trump is now increasing pressure on Zelensky to endorse the proposal, leaving Kyiv with little room to manoeuvre, as FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg explains from Kyiv.

items.title: Ukraine risks ‘losing a key partner’ with Trump’s peace proposal, Zelensky says
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that he would not betray Ukraine's interests in a US-led peace process, warning that Kyiv faces a choice between safeguarding its dignity and risking a rupture with Washington. The 28-point plan the United States presented to Kyiv was laden with Russian demands, including Ukrainian territorial concessions.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that he would not betray Ukraine's interests in a US-led peace process, warning that Kyiv faces a choice between safeguarding its dignity and risking a rupture with Washington. The 28-point plan the United States presented to Kyiv was laden with Russian demands, including Ukrainian territorial concessions.

items.title: White House urges Ukraine to accept peace plan as Zelenskyy weighs repercussions
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials
items.content: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials

ai_summary: President Zelenskyy warns of difficult choices regarding a Trump-proposed peace plan.
The plan reportedly involves Ukraine ceding territory to Russia and making concessions.
Details of the US-Russian plan are not yet fully clear, but it is a 28-point framework.
Ukraine is facing pressure to accept the US peace proposal, which favors Russia.
Zelenskyy is discussing the plan with allies as Trump sets a Thanksgiving deadline.

items.title: Africa's first G20 summit opens with an ambitious agenda and a US boycott
items.standfirst: Africa's first G20 summit opened in South Africa on Saturday without the world's biggest economy after US President Donald Trump ordered a boycott of the two-day gathering. The summit looked set to be overshadowed by Trump's unilateral plan to end the war in Ukraine as well as the continuing deadlock at COP30 climate negotiations taking place in Brazil.
items.content: Africa's first G20 summit opened in South Africa on Saturday without the world's biggest economy after US President Donald Trump ordered a boycott of the two-day gathering. The summit looked set to be overshadowed by Trump's unilateral plan to end the war in Ukraine as well as the continuing deadlock at COP30 climate negotiations taking place in Brazil.

ai_summary: The G20 summit in Johannesburg opened with South African President Ramaphosa's address.
The summit is the first G20 meeting held in Africa, with an ambitious agenda.
The US is boycotting the summit, and Trump is notably absent from the gathering.
Discussions are expected to be overshadowed by the Ukraine war and Trump's plan.
Delegates are discussing long-standing problems affecting the world's poorest nations.

clusters.title: Over 300 students were abducted by Nigerian gunmen from Catholic school
clusters.neutral_headline: Over 200 Students Abducted from Nigerian Catholic School

items.title: Over 300 students were abducted by Nigerian gunmen from Catholic school
items.standfirst: No group has yet claimed responsibility for this or a previous abduction, as authorities deploy rescue squads.
items.content: No group has yet claimed responsibility for this or a previous abduction, as authorities deploy rescue squads.

items.title: Attacks in Nigeria: Over 300 students and staff kidnapped in Niger state raid
items.standfirst: A total of 303 students and 12 teachers were kidnapped by armed men during an attack on St. Mary’s School, a Catholic institution in Niger state in north-central Nigeria, the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) said Saturday. The updated figure revises an earlier count of 215 students. The numbers were adjusted “after a verification exercise and a final headcount,” according to a statement from Most Rev. Bulus Dauwa Yohanna, chairman of CAN’s Niger state chapter, who visited the school on Friday. Morgan Ayre reports.
items.content: A total of 303 students and 12 teachers were kidnapped by armed men during an attack on St. Mary’s School, a Catholic institution in Niger state in north-central Nigeria, the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) said Saturday. The updated figure revises an earlier count of 215 students. The numbers were adjusted “after a verification exercise and a final headcount,” according to a statement from Most Rev. Bulus Dauwa Yohanna, chairman of CAN’s Niger state chapter, who visited the school on Friday. Morgan Ayre reports.

items.title: Gunmen abduct more than 200 pupils from Nigerian Catholic school
items.standfirst: The Christian Association of Nigeria said 215 students and 12 members of staff were taken during the raid on Friday.
items.content: The Christian Association of Nigeria said 215 students and 12 members of staff were taken during the raid on Friday.

items.title: Nigeria reels after 215 children taken in second mass school abduction in a week
items.standfirst: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...
items.content: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...

items.title: Gunmen kidnap more than 200 students from school in Nigeria
items.standfirst: Over 200 students have been kidnapped from a Catholic boarding school in western Nigeria - the second mass abduction in the country this week.
items.content: Over 200 students have been kidnapped from a Catholic boarding school in western Nigeria - the second mass abduction in the country this week.

ai_summary: Gunmen abducted over 300 students and staff from a Catholic school in Nigeria.
The attack occurred at St. Mary's School in Niger state, Nigeria.
This is the second mass school abduction in Nigeria within a week.
Authorities have deployed rescue squads to search for the abducted students.
The abductions follow threats from Trump regarding "Christian genocide."

clusters.title: ‘Cheering for him’: Key takeaways from Trump-Mamdani White House meeting

items.title: ‘Cheering for him’: Key takeaways from Trump-Mamdani White House meeting
items.standfirst: President Trump and the mayor-elect adopt a markedly warmer tone after months of insults, catching many off guard.
items.content: President Trump and the mayor-elect adopt a markedly warmer tone after months of insults, catching many off guard.

items.title: Trump praises New York mayor-elect Mamdani at warm White House meeting
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump and New York's incoming progressive mayor Zohran Mamdani were all smiles at a White House meeting on Friday, promising to set aside months of bitter feuding and cooperate on the city's future. Trump, who had previously labelled Mamdani a "100% Communist Lunatic", said the incoming mayor would do a "great job" leading the nation's biggest city.
items.content: US President Donald Trump and New York's incoming progressive mayor Zohran Mamdani were all smiles at a White House meeting on Friday, promising to set aside months of bitter feuding and cooperate on the city's future. Trump, who had previously labelled Mamdani a "100% Communist Lunatic", said the incoming mayor would do a "great job" leading the nation's biggest city.

items.title: Watch full video of the Trump-Mamdani meeting

items.content: In a surprising shift of tone, the two were positive and often complimentary, with President Trump saying NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani "can do some things that I think are gonna be really great."

items.title: The stakes behind Zohran Mamdani and Donald Trump’s first face-to-face
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump is about to meet New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani on Friday, their first face-to-face after trading insults for weeks. Mamdani requested the meeting to discuss living costs and public safety, while Trump has threatened to cut federal funding to the city and branded the 34-year-old democratic socialist a 'radical left lunatic'. FRANCE 24's international editor Douglas Herbert analyses the stakes of this first meeting.
items.content: President Donald Trump is about to meet New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani on Friday, their first face-to-face after trading insults for weeks. Mamdani requested the meeting to discuss living costs and public safety, while Trump has threatened to cut federal funding to the city and branded the 34-year-old democratic socialist a 'radical left lunatic'. FRANCE 24's international editor Douglas Herbert analyses the stakes of this first meeting.

ai_summary: President Trump and New York City Mayor-elect Mamdani met at the White House.
The meeting was marked by surprising moments of praise between the two.
Trump said they had a "very productive" conversation about New York City.
Trump previously labeled Mamdani a "100% Communist Lunatic."
The meeting signaled a shift from months of bitter feuding between the two.

items.title: Washington State resident dies in first confirmed H5N5 bird flu case, health department says
Bird flu: first ever death from rare H5N5 strain is recorded in US
items.standfirst: Washington state resident’s backyard flock of domestic poultry had been exposed to wild birds, health officials saidA person in the US is believed to be the first human to die from a rare strain of bird flu, but state health officials said on Friday the risk to the public is low.The person in Washington state, an older adult with underlying health conditions, was being treated for a bird flu strain called H5N5 after becoming seemingly the first known human infected by the strain, according to a statement from the Washington State Department of Health.This article was amended on 22 November 2025 after the AP corrected its copy to remove a reference to the person’s gender, which has not been released by health officials Continue reading...
items.content: Washington state resident’s backyard flock of domestic poultry had been exposed to wild birds, health officials saidA person in the US is believed to be the first human to die from a rare strain of bird flu, but state health officials said on Friday the risk to the public is low.The person in Washington state, an older adult with underlying health conditions, was being treated for a bird flu strain called H5N5 after becoming seemingly the first known human infected by the strain, according to a statement from the Washington State Department of Health.This article was amended on 22 November 2025 after the AP corrected its copy to remove a reference to the person’s gender, which has not been released by health officials Continue reading...

items.title: Washington resident dies from rare strain of bird flu, health officials say

The person's backyard flock of poultry had been exposed to wild birds.

items.standfirst: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...

items.content: The U.S. Supreme Court has temporarily blocked a lower court ruling that found Texas' 2026 congressional redistricting plan pushed by President Trump likely discriminates on the basis of race. (Image credit: Eric Gay)

ai_summary: The Supreme Court blocked a lower court ruling.
The lower court found the Texas map likely racially biased.
The Texas map was part of Trump's plan.
The plan aimed to win extra Republican seats.
The Supreme Court's action was temporary.

clusters.title: Fighter jet pilot killed in Dubai Air Show crash
clusters.neutral_headline: Fighter jet pilot killed in Dubai Air Show crash

items.title: Fighter jet pilot killed in Dubai Air Show crash
items.standfirst: The pilot of an Indian Air Force fighter jet was killed when his plane crashed and burst into flames on the final day of the Dubai Air Show.
items.content: The pilot of an Indian Air Force fighter jet was killed when his plane crashed and burst into flames on the final day of the Dubai Air Show.

items.title: Plane crashes at Dubai air show
items.standfirst: An Indian jet fighter crashed during a demonstration flight in front of a crowd of spectators at the Dubai Air Show.
items.content: An Indian jet fighter crashed during a demonstration flight in front of a crowd of spectators at the Dubai Air Show.

ai_summary: An Indian Air Force fighter jet crashed at the Dubai Air Show.
The pilot of the jet was killed in the crash.
The plane burst into flames after the crash.
The crash occurred on the final day of the show.
The crash happened during a demonstration flight.
